title: SAM Home
content:
SAM Home is the landing page after you sign in to SAM. When you enter the SAM Home, the On-premises tab page appears by default.

On-premises tab

On the left pane, open the Publisher list. It includes an Overview dashboard and some publisher-specific dashboards for on-premises products.

Overview dashboard

The Overview dashboard provides an overview of all on-premises products, including their compliance status and the most at-risk products assessed based on the latest compliance calculation result.

This table lists the charts on the Overview dashboard. You can click the bars to drill down and view more information about product compliance.

Chart Description Note
Current compliance meter

Displays the compliance status of managed products, excluding those that don't exist in the production environment.

Click a bar to view a list of compliant or noncompliant products and their compliance information. 
  • Created at: The time when the product record is created.
  • Estimated cost: The estimated cost calculated based on the license gap between software installations and consumed licenses. For more information about this field, see Compliance.
Compliance trend in past 6 months

Displays the changes in the compliance status of managed products in the past six months.

Hover over a bar to view the number of products that are either compliant or noncompliant in that month.

Click the bar to view more information about the list of compliant or noncompliant products in that month.
Top 5 products at risk

Lists the top 5 products at risk based on the estimated cost. The ranking considers whether the product is noncompliant and the estimated cost of purchasing a new license. The report lists the product whose licenses will be purchased at a higher cost closer to the top.

Hover over a bar to view the estimated amount of extra money you need to spend on bringing the product back to compliance.

Click the bar to view more compliance information of each product version.
Top 5 products overspent

Lists the top 5 overspent products based on the estimated cost. The ranking considers whether a product is compliant and the estimated overspent cost. The report lists the product whose licenses are overspent at a larger amount closer to the bottom.

Hover over a bar to view the amount of money that you have overspent on that product.

Click the bar to view more compliance information of that overspent product.

List view columns

You can customize your view of the available fields in each record. For more information, see List view columns topic.

Publisher-specific dashboards

After you calculate license compliance, SAM Home provides a publisher-specific dashboard with the following out-of-the-box (OOTB) charts similar to those in the Overview dashboard:

  • Current compliance meter
  • Compliance trend in past 6 months
  • Top 5 products at risk
  • Top 5 products overspent
  • For IBM, the product vendor must be IBM (ILMT). For more information, see Create compliance reports for ILMT-managed products.
  • Currently, SAM only supports Adobe's named-user licenses and their compliance calculation.

Additional charts for specific publishers

Oracle

In addition to the OOTB charts, SAM provides four more charts to show the license compliance and utilization of Oracle products.

Chart Description
Oracle database compliance

Displays information on the license usage of Oracle Database products by edition.

Click a bar to view the details of a product edition. On the page that appears, you can switch between the Licenses available list and the Licenses consumed list.
Oracle database options/packs compliance

Displays information on the license usage of Oracle Database options and management packs.

Click each bar to view detailed information. On the page that appears, you can switch between the Licenses available list and the Licenses consumed list.
Oracle database licenses required

Displays the number of extra licenses needed for using the Oracle Database options and management packs.

Hover over the bars to view the numbers.

Click a bar to view the compliance information about that product.
Utilization of Oracle database options/packs

Displays the utilization status of the Oracle Database options and management packs. The statuses include:

  • In use: specifies the number of Oracle Database options and management packs that are in use at the last sampling time.
  • Never used: specifies the number of installed Oracle Database options and management packs that you never use by the time of the last sampling.
  • Last used within 366 days: specifies the number of Oracle Database options and management packs that are last accessed within 366 days and earlier than the sampling time.
  • Last used more than 366 days ago: specifies the number of Oracle Database options and management packs that are last accessed more than 366 days ago.

Click the bar to view the detailed information about products in different statuses.
Red Hat

For Red Hat Enterprise Linux, SAM provides an additional chart to compare the costs of two different subscription options and calculate the potential savings. 

Chart Description
Potential license cost optimization
for Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)

Displays the potential savings for subscribing to the RHEL Server or RHEL for Virtual Datacenters.

Click the bar to view the details of potential license cost optimization for Single device and Cluster.

When the Allocated license isn't a cost-efficient option based on the cost optimization threshold, the device will be listed out in the details page. For more information about the cost optimization threshold, see Create compliance reports for Red Hat products.

The Single device and Cluster tables include the following information:

Table Description
Single device
  • Name : Nam e of the device.
  • Model: Model of the device.
  • Number of processors: The total number of physical processors on the device.
  • Cores per procssor: The total number of cores per processor.
  • Number of RHEL VMS: The total number of virtual machines that deployed the Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
  • Virtualization: The virtualization technology.
  • RHEL Server consumption: The RHEL Server licenses consumed by the device.
  • Cost for RHEL Server: The estimated cost of RHEL Server licenses consumed by the device.
  • RHEL for VDC consumption: The RHEL for VDC licenses consumed by the device.
  • Cost for RHEL VDC: The estimated cost of RHEL for VDC license consumed by the device.
  • Allocated license: The licenses allocated from the existing license pool.
  • Optimal license: The optimal license for the device. 
  • Potential cost savings: Potential cost savings between optimal license choices and allocated licenses.
  • Description: Suggestions on virtual environment deployment, license allocation, and procurement.
Cluster
  • Cluster: Name of the cluster. You can drill down to check the device list in the cluster.
  • Cluster type: Type of the cluster.
  • RHEL Server consumption: The RHEL Server licenses consumed by the cluster.
  • Cost for RHEL Server: The estimated cost of RHEL Server licenses consumed by the cluster.
  • RHEL for VDC consumption: The RHEL for VDC licenses consumed by the cluster.
  • Cost for RHEL VDC: The estimated cost of RHEL for VDC license consumed by the cluster.
  • Allocated license: The licenses allocated from the existing license pool.
  • Optimal license: The optimal license for the cluster. 
  • Potential cost savings: Potential cost savings between optimal license choices and allocated licenses.
  • Description: Suggestions on virtual environment deployment, license allocation, and procurement. 

SaaS tab

Go to the SaaS tab and open the Publisher list on the left pane. It includes an Overview dashboard and some publisher-specific dashboards for SaaS products.

Overview dashboard

The Overview dashboard provides an overview of all SaaS products, including the budget and license management information of SaaS products.

This table lists the charts on the Overview dashboard. You can click the bars to drill down and view more information.

Chart Description
Total cost

Displays total cost of all managed SaaS products and the number of calculated products.

Click the bar to view a list of managed SaaS products along with their compliance status, total cost per product, currency, and the time of the last compliance calculation.
Potential savings

Displays potential cost savings in the following three scenarios:

  1. No Service Management user matches.
  2. Matched Service Management users but under the inactive status.
  3. User's last login exceeds the default threshold. 
    By default, the threshold is 30 days, and you can change it in the product settings.
Unrecognized user entitlement

Displays the total count of user entitlement records that don't have corresponding matches among Service Management users.
Top 5 products of highest costs

Lists the top 5 most expensive SaaS products within the organization.
Top 5 products with potential cost savings Lists the top 5 SaaS products with the greatest potential for cost savings.

Publisher-specific dashboards

After you calculate license compliance, SAM Home provides a publisher-specific dashboard with the following out-of-the-box (OOTB) charts similar to those in the Overview dashboard:

  • Total cost
  • Potential savings
  • Unrecognized user entitlement
  • Top 5 products of highest costs
  • Top 5 products with potential cost savings

Related topics

  • SAM best practice
  • List view columns
